name: Fidelity
description: Excellent low cost brokerage offering investing and banking services. Currently where I do most of my investing.
pros: Buy any share/ETF in fractional amounts.
Cashback automatically deposited into Fidelity account.
cons: App and website are a bit outdated.

name: Schwab
description: Low cost brokerage and banking services.
pros: Cashback automatically deposited into Fidelity account.
cons: Can only transfer money between investment and checking accounts during business hours of 7am-7pm.

name: Vanguard
description: One of the oldest fund providers who pioneering index based investing. Many Bogleheads swear by it, though I find its customer services and website to be patchy.
pros: Good for managing corporation retirement plans.

name: Merrill Edge
description: Self directed brokerage from Bank of America.
pros: $0 trading for stocks and ETFs if have a large enough balance.
Can be used to maintain Platinum status at Bank of America without having a large cash balance.
